'''0.0.20a_01'''<ref>http://web.archive.org/web/20181207044622/http://tinypic.com/view.php?pic=2lvlc14&s=5</ref> is a version of [[Java Edition Classic]] released alongside server version [[Classic server 1.8.2|1.8.2]] on June 20, 2009, at 21:11 UTC to fix bugs.<ref name="blog">https://web.archive.org/web/20090926233412/http://notch.tumblr.com/post/127176580/new-minecraft-server-zip-new-client New minecraft-server.zip, new client - June 20, 2009 – This blog post mentions that it fixed players being able to build using unbreakable blocks, which is also mentioned in the [[#logs|IRC logs]]: "''P4:09:25 <Notch> new minecraft-server.zip that doesn't allow that block''" (21:09:25 UTC), therefore the blog post ''does'' refer to this version.</ref><ref>[[#logs|IRC logs]]: "''P4:11:32 <Awol10> wingboy: tried downloading again. the jar file should have an 11:09pm timestamp''" (21:11:32 UTC)</ref>

== Changes ==
=== Gameplay ===
'''[[File:Hotbar.png|200px]] [[Hotbar]]'''
* [[Cobblestone]] positions are now switched to second slot in the hotbar.<ref>[[#logs|IRC logs]]: "''P5:05:09 <mezo> notch, in the last version dirt was 2 and cobble was 3, now it's the other way around''" [...] "''P5:05:23 <Notch> ah! that's intentional, mezo''" (22:05 UTC)</ref>
* [[Dirt]] positions are now switched to third slot in the hotbar.<ref>[[#logs|IRC logs]]: "''P5:05:09 <mezo> notch, in the last version dirt was 2 and cobble was 3, now it's the other way around''" [...] "''P5:05:23 <Notch> ah! that's intentional, mezo''" (22:05 UTC)</ref>

== Fixes ==
'''3 bugs fixed'''
* Fixed a bug that caused clients to build unbreakable blocks.<ref name="blog"/>
* Fixed a protocol error.<ref name="blog"/>
* Fixed FPS issues.<ref name="FPS and water">[[#logs|IRC logs]]:  "''P4:13:25 <Notch> does it work better now?''" [...] "''P4:13:36 <LKA> Notch: FPS is fine now but water transparency is broken now''" (21:13 UTC)</ref>

== Bugs ==
'''5 bugs reported'''
* Water transparency is bugged.<ref name="FPS and water"/><ref>[[#logs|IRC logs]]: "''P4:12:28 <LKA> water transparency is being hilariously awkward''" (21:14:23 UTC)</ref>
** Sometimes, the water looks opaque.<ref>[[#logs|IRC logs]]: "''P4:14:23 <LKA> I dunno, for me sometimes the water is opaque then I look down from the surface and I can see through it just fine''" (21:14:23 UTC)</ref>
** Water tiles have light blue bits in their borders.<ref>[[#logs|IRC logs]]: "''P4:16:04 <Syndlig> Looking straight down at water...''" [...] "''P4:16:08 <Syndlig> It turns into a grid.''", "''P4:16:14 <Syndlig> Light blue lines at the corners of the water tiles.''" [...] "''P4:16:38 <Notch> yeah, water tiles have weird borders''" [...] "''P4:17:26 <LKA> It goes through various shades of opaqueness''" (21:16 to 21:17 UTC)</ref>
* Usernames are now harder to read.<ref>[[#logs|IRC logs]]: "''P4:14:32 <paul|2> I'm getting errors with names''" [...] "''P4:14:38 <paul|2> the dropshadow gets a bit weird''" [...] "''P4:28:04 <Syndlig> The closer a player is to you the whiter their name gets.''" [...] "''P4:28:12 <Syndlig> If they're next to you the name is white-on-white and unreadable.''" [...] "''P4:29:38 <wingboy> the names above peoples head look weird''" [...] "''P4:30:30 <ez> yes, names look odd''" (21:24 to 21:28 UTC)</ref>
* If the player aims at a certain angle while placing a block, it appears to go inside an existing block,<ref>[[#logs|IRC logs]]: "''P4:52:16 <Kapow> if you aim at a certain angle it wants to build the new block inside the existing one''" (21:52 UTC)</ref> due to a bug caused by using OpenGL picking.
** Specifically, looking at [[glass]] or [[leaves]] causes this bug to happen.
